title: Laners Love Complaining When Jungler Doesn't Gank
body:
But when their lane opponents are in your jungle for 50% of their play time they seem well obliged just to stand under their own turret daydreaming while the wave is pushed to the enemy tower. Oh let me guess, you had more important things to do like securing objectives and ganking other lanes?

If your lane enemy is always in your jungler, and you don't feel like helping, at least do something useful like push the lane and deny him farm or gank another lane or take an objective. Because when we junglers aren't ganking your lane, at least we are doing something, somewhere on the map.

Yes a salt post, just got out of a game where the enemy support Malz, mid Talon and top Trynd were permanently in my jungle. Did team push objectives? Nope. Did they deny the enemy farm and push? Nope. Did they take a tower? Nope. They actively, sat there, under their tower, doing absolutely nothing of objective value, complaining about not getting ganks, while I was in the middle of running from the enemy support and mid laner, pinging for help... wow...

Things the laner could be accomplishing while their enemy is chasing me.

~~Collapse on the enemy and kill them~~
Shove waves hard, for farm and exp(While denying their opponents the same)
Shove wave and damage or take the enemy tower.
Shove wave then go kill their weakened lane enemy.
Shove wave then take an objective or enemy camps.
Shove wave and take dragon.
Shove wave then gank/tp gank another lane.
Shove wave and back to buy items while the pressure is off.

But they would stall under their own tower to type in chat how awful I was because I wasn't ganking. While their laners were actively chasing me away from my camps.
Meanwhile whenever i split push into the enemy teams inhib my team is just casually farming the jungle :^}

My complaint to junglers is when theirs does a level 3 gank and ours doesnt invade, doesnt gank or even show up in another lane. Usually its fine and understandable since it happened and theres nothing you can do about it now except maybe invade, but if you dont show up on the map while the enemy jg went to 3 lanes already and has the same farm as you getting pressure everywhere and keeping up/beating you in farm then I get irritated.

Another time is when i let the enemy laner push into my tower, and i see you in the river near my lane and ping and you just spam /L and leave. (when its still a 0-0 lane)
While I know sometimes it's a l2p issue, aren't there cases where some junglers are better at ganking, while others are better at farming?

You are completely correct. 

I main jungle and can attest that all jungle champs have their strengths and weaknesses when it comes to farm or gank potential. Junglers with hard CC (stuns, knockups) and good damage are usually great early game gankers like Jax, Zac, Vi, Ivern, and Elise, especially when they have a laner who also has some form of CC or hard CC that can cause a stun lock or keep the enemy from being able to escape. Other jungle champs like Yi, Shaco, Evelyne, and Kha, have a much harder time getting early ganks (taking out the skill of the summoner) unless a good opportunity is created by your team or bad plays by the enemy team. These assassin's require the laner to possess more of the CC so that their high damage can assist in a gank. Setup is definitely key to any early game gank or ganks in general.

Technically all junglers are "good" at ganking as long as the opportunity is available however damage output and CC are the usual deciding factor for a successful gank. Early game is difficult for some junglers like Sej, Maoaki, and Nunu due to their general tankiness over damage. Although they may posses good CC they don't add as much to the overall kill potential. These champs tend to clear camps and farm up for their ults to help in a gank. Before WW rework he was the poster child for this statement as it was gank at 6 or bust for him (nocturne is similar however his fear and damage make him still a solid early ganker).

TL:DR - Setup, CC, and good damage output are the recipe for success for a gank early or in general.

I hope this helped answer your question/thought.

The issue is that the ban bot (and btw, not a single ban is reviewed by a person, I can prove this, so if you are curious feel free to ask) doesn't discriminate between these two. I will not be doing this, as I believe that the context of my words are equally important to my words themselves. I was confrontational, I do not deny this, but I was confrontational in the face of extreme adversity, and for Riot to actually claim that "context doesn't matter" even in the face of all the shit that happened to PewDiePie is just fucking frightening.

>What do you expect? Should Riot hook people up with therapists for mommy issues if they punish them for saying "i fckd ur mom"? What exactly do you think would reasonable and practical at the same time?

YES, THIS IS EXACTLY WHAT I WANT. How many reports do you think are lodged for legitimately toxic offenses? I would bet less than half, and that's a fairly liberal estimate. The rest are filed because one person simply didn't like the other, and they happened to say something like "fuck you" in chat. TECHNICALLY, this is bannable, but this is NOT what actually caused the offense. Riot is, in effect, banning players like me on a technicality, not on real offenses. People do not generally like me, as I come off as very abrasive and confrontational, and I have 0 tolerance for bullshit. This puts me at odds with many people that don't actually take the time to get to know me (which is not possible during a 30 minute game), but this is NOT toxic. However, occasionally I'll drop a "fuck you" or other such "negative" phrase, and THIS is what gets flagged as toxic. Not my actual attitude, but the technicality of my actions. Without a completely transparent "you got banned for exactly this sentence" policy, there is very little means for people like me to "reform".

Don't have the logs. The ban was temporary and has long since expired. But I'll tell you exactly the line that got me banned:

>/all: please report my team, they are harassing me and accusing me of trolling

The joke being that I was playing support pantheon AFTER I ACTUALLY ASKED THEM IF THEY WERE COOL WITH IT.

The fact that I even spoke in all chat to try for some small amount of catharsis triggered a 2 week ban. That's logical. The game was already lost, and had long since devolved into a toxic mess due to the rampant accusations of trolling by my teammates and me telling our jungler that if he was going to levy such accusations that he should at least know how to gank.

And the proof that they don't review punishments is that I received my ban at ~12:30am, which was MINUTES (3-5) after the final game on my reform ticket ended. First, no one is even reviewing at that time. Second, 3-5minutes is simply NOT enough time for even a shit review of chat logs, hence, it was done entirely by an automated system. This is fact. Fact with which you simply cannot argue. And if you don't believe me, just sit back and try to remember the last time you got a notification about a player you reported getting banned. It probably was probably only a couple of minutes after the game in which you reported said player. Fact is, Riot does NOT review ANY of their bans. And based on the number of false permabans I see contested on the forums and ultimately overturned after a lengthy and frankly unacceptable process, I have a strong feeling that these are largely handled by the banbot, as well.

Literally all of the problems with the system would be solved by bringing back the Tribunal. As it stands, players (like me) who show enough competitive drive to criticize teammates' performances and not be willing to deal with bullshit and trolling are being utterly purged from this game, resulting in an ever increasing cesspool of casual shit players. I played for a couple years with the Tribunal, and they were simply not as strict, despite what Riot Games claims. Also, the Tribunal could clearly see the context and rule based on the ENTIRE case, not just the evidence that showed guilt. The only "problem" with the Tribunal is that it did take quite some time to hand out the ban, but if time is the only price for true and rational justice, then I have absolutely no problem with that. 

A system that punishes 1 innocent person is infinitely worse than one that lets 10 guilty ones go free, and that is the basis of virtually every first world justice system in the fucking world, except for this bullshit that Riot has given us.

If you're behind, then what you do is farm under turret, correct? And when they're fed, they'll push the turret and roam/counter jgl, as they're supposed to. If you, as the jgler, are letting them constantly push without punishing them, so they can roam and counterjg whenever they want, that's on you.

If you want them to shove, then the laner comes back and the lane ends up being frozen and the laner gets zoned out of all the cs and xp, and risks dying even trying to get in range of the minion death xp. And what happens when they die trying to soak xp? 

"WTF WHY ARE YOU PUSHING SO FAR U R BEHIND STAY UNDER TURRET NOOB"

if not frozen, the enemy laner's already more fed, with better items they can shove the wave much faster than you. 

It's a loselose situation, the only way is for the enemy fed laner to die, and the gank is the best way to do this. 

The jgler is the most important role. Objective control used to be a lot more important, but ganking has proven itself to be much more efficient. The best "objective control" now is counterjgling, so the enemy doesn't have the resources to gank.
